content.question: Let <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 1 minus, x squared " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and below by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, x squared, minus 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="negative 1, less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shaded in the figure above. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 3 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.12: Volume with Washer Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
